vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/6600dd35-ac34-41ec-88a6-2a8e2aa830bb">YOUTH</keyword>         <topcClas>Social attitudes and behaviour - Society and culture</topcClas>         <topcClas>Youth - Social stratification and groupings</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The <i>Young Life and Times Survey</i> (YLT) originally began as a companion survey to the <I>Northern Ireland Life and Times Survey</I> series (available at the UK Data Archive under GN 33235). From 1998-2000, YLT surveyed young people aged 12-17 living in the households of adults interviewed for NILT. Subsequently, YLT underwent evaluation in 2001 and was relaunched in 2003 (see SN 4826), independent of the adult NILT and using a completely different methodology. From this point, YLT has used Child Benefit records as a sampling frame and contacts all young people whose 16th birthday falls in February of the survey year. Although a few questions are asked that are also included in NILT, the rest of the survey now covers different topics.<br> <br> The aims of the YLT series are to:<ul><li>monitor public attitudes towards social policy and political issues in Northern Ireland</li><li>provide a time series on attitudes to key social policy areas</li><li>facilitate academic social policy analysis</li><li>provide a freely available resource on public attitudes for the wider community of users in Northern Ireland</li><li>give a voice to young people</li></ul>An open access time-series teaching dataset has been created from the 2003-2012 YLTs - see SN 7548.<br> <br> Further information about the YLT, including publications, may be found on the Access Research Knowledge (ARK) <a href="http://www.ark.ac.uk/nilt/ylt/index.html" title="Young Life and Times Survey">YLT</a> webpages.<br> <br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>The 2006 survey covered the following topics: <br> <ul><li>school experiences</li><li>family life</li><li> mental health</li><li>global and environmental issues</li><li>community relations</li></ul></abstract>       <sumDscr>         <collDate event="start" date="2006-08-01T00:00:00Z">August 2006</collDate>         <collDate event="end" date="2006-10-01T00:00:00Z">October 2006</collDate>         <nation>Northern Ireland</nation>         <geogUnit>No spatial unit</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Individuals</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>Northern Irish young people</universe>         <universe>Young people in Northern Ireland whose 16th birthday was in February 2006</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Individual (micro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Repeated cross-sectional study</timeMeth>         <timeMeth>Some survey questions are repeated annually.</timeMeth>         <dataCollector>Research and Evaluation Services</dataCollector>         <sampProc>Simple random sample</sampProc>         <deviat>722 cases</deviat>         <collMode>Telephone interview; Postal survey</collMode>         <collMode>Online self-completion</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>No weighting used</weight>         <cleanOps>A*</cleanOps>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Standard conditions of access</specPerm>         <restrctn>The depositor has specified that registration is required and standard conditions of use apply. The depositor may be informed about usage.
